text:
Good morning, Mike, How do you come up with these numbers? Chrome, for example,
released 6 separate desktop versions after last Patch Tuesday (Oct 10th), though
only 5 were for Windows, with a sum total of 23 security vulnerabilities. The
first build of 119 fixed 15 vulnerabilities, but there have been 5
vulnerabilities fixed since and 3 fixed in 118 prior to the release of 119. If
the numbers were based on only the release on Patch Tuesday then it should be 4.
If it's November then 5. If v119 then 20. If everything since last Patch Tuesday
then 23. There were, of course, even more that they discovered with internal
tools, but these are the numbers that they publish publicly before the 14 week
embargo. Date Version Sec =========== =================== === 2023-11-14
119.0.6045.159/.160 4 2023-11-07 119.0.6045.123/.124 1 2023-10-31
119.0.6045.105/.106 15 2023-10-24 118.0.5993.117/.118 2 2023-10-19 118.0.5993.96
0 (macOS only) 2023-10-17 118.0.5993.88/.89 1
https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchromereleases.googleblog.com%2Fsearch%2Flabel%2FStable%2520updates&data=05%7C01%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C12e76211b2e146f71fe108dbe647f962%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638356969033704647%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=on2mV6MaSdwO1r4tEy0pkupkTgCSEe0jc01ARvLInug%3D&reserved=0
This is one of my biggest pet peeves with these posts about numbers of
vulns/apps/fixes, since no two are the same and their data doesn't always jive
with the vendor. -S
Link: None

metadata.topic: November Patch Tuesday Analysis by Action1
